alert.note: Alert for Parke; Vermillion; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 9:16PM EST until January 15 at 9:24AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River at Montezuma. .Rainfall amounts of one to two inches across central Indiana yesterday, combined with widespread rains of one to two inches earlier in the week, is bringing elevated river levels to the area. Minor lowland flooding is occurring on the Wabash River at Montezuma, which started late Saturday afternoon and is expected to last into Sunday night. River levels should crest close to flood stage in the Hutsonville and Riverton area. Flood warnings may be later needed for these locations. Flooding is not expected for the foreseeable future for forecast locations along the White and East Fork rivers and their tributaries. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Montezuma. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Several hundred acres of bottomlands along the right bank from the mouth of Sugar Creek to northern edge of Montezuma begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Saturday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Saturday was 14.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Sunday afternoon by around 1230 PM EST.
